title: Relates to the training of boards of directors or trustees of certain voluntary not-for-profit facilities or corporations

       Introduced  by  M.  of  A. P. RIVERA, JAFFEE, LUPARDO, SCHROEDER -- read
         once and referred to the Committee on Mental Health

       AN ACT to amend the mental hygiene law, in relation to the  training  of
         boards  of  directors  or trustees of certain voluntary not-for-profit
         facilities or corporations

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.    Section  7.09  of  the mental hygiene law is amended by
    2  adding a new subdivision (k) to read as follows:
    3    (K) THE COMMISSIONER SHALL PROMULGATE RULES AND REGULATIONS  REQUIRING
    4  THAT  BOARDS OF DIRECTORS OF VOLUNTARY NOT-FOR-PROFIT AGENCIES WHICH ARE
    5  LICENSED BY, FUNDED BY OR UNDER  CONTRACT  WITH  THE  OFFICE,  WITH  THE
    6  EXCEPTION  OF HOSPITALS OPERATED PURSUANT TO ARTICLE TWENTY-EIGHT OF THE
    7  PUBLIC HEALTH LAW, SHALL ADOPT POLICIES AND GUIDELINES  WITH  REGARD  TO
    8  OPERATING  PROCEDURES IN THE EVENT OF EMERGENCY SITUATIONS AFFECTING THE
    9  HEALTH OR SAFETY OF INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES SERVED BY  THE  AGENCY
   10  OR THE FISCAL VIABILITY OR INTEGRITY OF THE AGENCY.
   11    S  2.   The section heading and subdivision (a) of section 7.39 of the
   12  mental hygiene law, as added by chapter 800 of the  laws  of  1986,  are
   13  amended and a new subdivision (a-1) is added to read as follows:
   14    Registration,  TRAINING  and  notification  of  boards of directors or
   15  trustees of certain voluntary not-for-profit facilities or corporations.
   16    (a) Notwithstanding any other law, rule or regulation,  the  executive
   17  director, chairperson or president of a voluntary, not-for-profit corpo-
   18  ration  or  facility  which is subject to the jurisdiction of the office
   19  [of mental health] shall furnish annually to the commissioner a list  of
   20  the names and addresses of the current members of the board of directors
   21  or  trustees of such facility or corporation TOGETHER WITH THE LAST DATE
   22  OF THE CURRENT MEMBERS' OR TRUSTEES' COMPLETION OF THE TRAINING REQUIRE-
   23  MENTS.   HOSPITALS OPERATED PURSUANT  TO  ARTICLE  TWENTY-EIGHT  OF  THE
   24  PUBLIC  HEALTH LAW SHALL NOT BE REQUIRED TO FURNISH COMPLETION OF TRAIN-

    1  ING REQUIREMENTS TO THE COMMISSIONER. NOTHING IN THIS SECTION  SHALL  BE
    2  CONSTRUED  TO  EXEMPT SUCH HOSPITALS FROM THE APPLICABLE REQUIREMENTS OF
    3  THE PUBLIC HEALTH LAW.  Failure to furnish [such] AN annual list [shall]
    4  OF  NAMES  AND ADDRESSES OF CURRENT MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS OR
    5  TRUSTEES MAY remove such facility or corporation from consideration  for
    6  recertification.
    7    (A-1)  THE  OFFICE SHALL ESTABLISH NO LATER THAN OCTOBER THIRTY-FIRST,
    8  TWO THOUSAND TWELVE MINIMUM TRAINING REQUIREMENTS FOR ALL MEMBERS OF THE
    9  BOARD OF DIRECTORS OR TRUSTEES OF  A  VOLUNTARY,  NOT-FOR-PROFIT  CORPO-
   10  RATION  OR  FACILITY WHICH IS SUBJECT TO THE JURISDICTION OF THE OFFICE,
   11  WITH  THE  EXCEPTION  OF  HOSPITALS   OPERATED   PURSUANT   TO   ARTICLE
   12  TWENTY-EIGHT  OF  THE  PUBLIC  HEALTH LAW.   SUCH INITIAL TRAINING SHALL
   13  INCLUDE, BUT NOT BE LIMITED TO, THE FIDUCIARY RESPONSIBILITIES OF  BEING
   14  A BOARD MEMBER OR TRUSTEE AND SHALL PROVIDE MEMBERS OR TRUSTEES WITH THE
   15  TOOLS  AND BEST PRACTICES NECESSARY TO EFFECTIVELY SERVE IN SUCH CAPACI-
   16  TY.
   17    S 3. The section heading and subdivision (a) of section 13.39  of  the
   18  mental  hygiene  law, the section heading as added by chapter 800 of the
   19  laws of 1986 and subdivision (a) as amended by chapter 168 of  the  laws
   20  of  2010,  are  amended  and a new subdivision (a-1) is added to read as
   21  follows:
   22    Registration, TRAINING and notification  of  boards  of  directors  or
   23  trustees of certain voluntary not-for-profit facilities or corporations.
   24    (a)  Notwithstanding  any other law, rule or regulation, the executive
   25  director, chairperson or president of a voluntary, not-for-profit corpo-
   26  ration or facility which is subject to the jurisdiction  of  the  office
   27  [for  people  with  developmental  disabilities],  WITH THE EXCEPTION OF
   28  HOSPITALS OPERATED PURSUANT TO ARTICLE TWENTY-EIGHT OF THE PUBLIC HEALTH
   29  LAW, shall furnish annually to the commissioner a list of the names  and
   30  addresses  of  the current members of the board of directors or trustees
   31  of such facility or corporation TOGETHER  WITH  THE  LAST  DATE  OF  THE
   32  CURRENT  MEMBERS'  OR TRUSTEES' COMPLETION OF THE TRAINING REQUIREMENTS.
   33  HOSPITALS OPERATED PURSUANT TO ARTICLE TWENTY-EIGHT OF THE PUBLIC HEALTH
   34  LAW SHALL NOT BE REQUIRED TO FURNISH COMPLETION OF TRAINING REQUIREMENTS
   35  TO THE COMMISSIONER. NOTHING IN  THIS  SECTION  SHALL  BE  CONSTRUED  TO
   36  EXEMPT  SUCH  HOSPITALS  FROM  THE APPLICABLE REQUIREMENTS OF THE PUBLIC
   37  HEALTH LAW. Failure to furnish [such] AN annual list  [shall]  OF  NAMES
   38  AND  ADDRESSES  OF CURRENT MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS OR TRUSTEES
   39  MAY remove such facility or corporation from consideration for recertif-
   40  ication.
   41    (A-1) THE OFFICE SHALL ESTABLISH NO LATER THAN  OCTOBER  THIRTY-FIRST,
   42  TWO THOUSAND TWELVE MINIMUM TRAINING REQUIREMENTS FOR ALL MEMBERS OF THE
   43  BOARD  OF  DIRECTORS  OR  TRUSTEES OF A VOLUNTARY, NOT-FOR-PROFIT CORPO-
   44  RATION OR FACILITY WHICH IS SUBJECT TO THE JURISDICTION OF  THE  OFFICE,
   45  WITH   THE   EXCEPTION   OF   HOSPITALS  OPERATED  PURSUANT  TO  ARTICLE
   46  TWENTY-EIGHT OF THE PUBLIC HEALTH LAW.    SUCH  INITIAL  TRAINING  SHALL
   47  INCLUDE,  BUT NOT BE LIMITED TO, THE FIDUCIARY RESPONSIBILITIES OF BEING
   48  A BOARD MEMBER OR TRUSTEE AND SHALL PROVIDE MEMBERS OR TRUSTEES WITH THE
   49  TOOLS AND BEST PRACTICES NECESSARY TO EFFECTIVELY SERVE IN SUCH  CAPACI-
   50  TY.
   51    S  4.  Section  13.09 of the mental hygiene law is amended by adding a
   52  new subdivision (h) to read as follows:
   53    (H) THE COMMISSIONER SHALL PROMULGATE RULES AND REGULATIONS  REQUIRING
   54  THAT  BOARDS OF DIRECTORS OF VOLUNTARY NOT-FOR-PROFIT AGENCIES WHICH ARE
   55  LICENSED BY, FUNDED BY OR UNDER  CONTRACT  WITH  THE  OFFICE,  WITH  THE
   56  EXCEPTION  OF HOSPITALS OPERATED PURSUANT TO ARTICLE TWENTY-EIGHT OF THE

    1  PUBLIC HEALTH LAW, SHALL ADOPT POLICIES AND GUIDELINES  WITH  REGARD  TO
    2  OPERATING  PROCEDURES IN THE EVENT OF EMERGENCY SITUATIONS AFFECTING THE
    3  HEALTH OR SAFETY OF INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES SERVED BY  THE  AGENCY
    4  OR THE FISCAL VIABILITY OR INTEGRITY OF THE AGENCY.
    5    S  5.  The section heading and subdivision (a) of section 32.37 of the
    6  mental hygiene law, as added by chapter 558 of the  laws  of  1999,  are
    7  amended and a new subdivision (a-1) is added to read as follows:
    8          Registration,  TRAINING  and notification of boards of directors
    9            or trustees of certain voluntary not-for-profit facilities  or
   10            corporations.
   11    (a)  Notwithstanding any other law, rule, or regulation, the executive
   12  director, chairperson or president of a voluntary, not-for-profit corpo-
   13  ration which has been issued an operating certificate by or has received
   14  funding from the office of alcoholism and substance abuse services, WITH
   15  THE EXCEPTION OF HOSPITALS OPERATED PURSUANT TO ARTICLE TWENTY-EIGHT  OF
   16  THE  PUBLIC  HEALTH  LAW,  shall furnish annually to the commissioner of
   17  such office a list of the names and addresses of the current members  of
   18  the board of directors or trustees of such corporation TOGETHER WITH THE
   19  LAST  DATE OF THE CURRENT MEMBERS' OR TRUSTEES' COMPLETION OF THE TRAIN-
   20  ING REQUIREMENTS.  HOSPITALS OPERATED PURSUANT TO  ARTICLE  TWENTY-EIGHT
   21  OF  THE PUBLIC HEALTH LAW SHALL NOT BE REQUIRED TO FURNISH COMPLETION OF
   22  TRAINING REQUIREMENTS TO THE COMMISSIONER OF  ALCOHOLISM  AND  SUBSTANCE
   23  ABUSE SERVICES. NOTHING IN THIS SUBDIVISION SHALL BE CONSTRUED TO EXEMPT
   24  SUCH  HOSPITALS  FROM  THE  APPLICABLE REQUIREMENTS OF THE PUBLIC HEALTH
   25  LAW. Failure to furnish [such] AN annual list OF NAMES AND ADDRESSES  OF
   26  CURRENT  MEMBERS  OF  THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS OR TRUSTEES may remove such
   27  corporation from consideration for recertification or refunding.
   28    (A-1) THE OFFICE OF ALCOHOLISM  AND  SUBSTANCE  ABUSE  SERVICES  SHALL
   29  ESTABLISH  NO LATER THAN OCTOBER THIRTY-FIRST, TWO THOUSAND TWELVE MINI-
   30  MUM TRAINING REQUIREMENTS FOR ALL MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF  DIRECTORS  OR
   31  TRUSTEES OF A VOLUNTARY, NOT-FOR-PROFIT CORPORATION OR FACILITY WHICH IS
   32  SUBJECT TO THE JURISDICTION OF SUCH OFFICE, WITH THE EXCEPTION OF HOSPI-
   33  TALS OPERATED PURSUANT TO ARTICLE TWENTY-EIGHT OF THE PUBLIC HEALTH LAW.
   34  SUCH  INITIAL TRAINING SHALL INCLUDE, BUT NOT BE LIMITED TO, THE FIDUCI-
   35  ARY RESPONSIBILITIES OF BEING  A  BOARD  MEMBER  OR  TRUSTEE  AND  SHALL
   36  PROVIDE  MEMBERS OR TRUSTEES WITH THE TOOLS AND BEST PRACTICES NECESSARY
   37  TO EFFECTIVELY SERVE IN SUCH CAPACITY.
   38    S 6. Section 19.09 of the mental hygiene law is amended  by  adding  a
   39  new subdivision (i) to read as follows:
   40    (I)  THE COMMISSIONER SHALL PROMULGATE RULES AND REGULATIONS REQUIRING
   41  THE BOARDS OF DIRECTORS OF VOLUNTARY NOT-FOR-PROFIT AGENCIES  WHICH  ARE
   42  LICENSED  BY,  FUNDED  BY  OR  UNDER  CONTRACT WITH THE OFFICE, WITH THE
   43  EXCEPTION OF HOSPITALS OPERATED PURSUANT TO ARTICLE TWENTY-EIGHT OF  THE
   44  PUBLIC HEALTH LAW, TO ADOPT POLICIES AND GUIDELINES WITH REGARD TO OPER-
   45  ATING  PROCEDURES  IN  THE  EVENT  OF EMERGENCY SITUATIONS AFFECTING THE
   46  HEALTH OR SAFETY OF INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES SERVED BY  THE  AGENCY
   47  OR THE FISCAL VIABILITY OR INTEGRITY OF THE AGENCY.
   48    S  7.  This  act shall take effect on the ninetieth day after it shall
   49  have become a law; provided, however, that  effective  immediately,  the
   50  addition,  amendment  and/or  repeal of any rule or regulation necessary
   51  for the implementation of this act on its effective date are  authorized
   52  and directed to be made and completed on or before such effective date.
